In fact, I remember my brilliant Consultant Spinal Surgeon looking at my complex cluster of comorbidities years ago and saying ‘This may not have a name yet but this is a condition. One day the science will catch up but until then it will be an art’. (He’s awesome fyi). https://t.co/yGz38gQN1Q

Many of my conditions were ‘hiding’ in plain sight including #Mito, #Endo, #EDS etc - and more recently Long Covid and POTS. I’m grateful for my diligent, compassionate consultants this is not the experience of many - especially for women, marginalised and minority populations https://t.co/yGz38gQN1Q

@D_Bone @fannyfrogg Dave, I’ve been there +empathise. Societal stigma and ablism can make the label of ‘disabled’ and need for assistance feel like a personal failure -but I promise you it isn’t. You’re still that hard working +ambitious guy. But you have a fundamental right to support at this time.

And finally our brilliant @SDDirect_global Disability Inclusion Helpdesk and partners have been consistently producing clear, concise and critical work on the impacts of the pandemic for people with disabilities and #OPDs. These can be found 👉https://t.co/pWZ4DydjRa 5/5

And on that note @bristolpoverty are hosting a Disability, Poverty and COVID19 series on these exact issues, with a UK focus in part 1 expanding to global scale in part 2. First webinar with @Paulineheslop @FaziletHadi and Laura Welti of @BDEFbites on 31/03 - register  ⬇️  4/ https://t.co/SoiCxqJbS8

Paper 👇 by @hannahkuper1 @TommyShakes @CalumDavey @morgonbanks is a cracking accessible read exploring the pathways through which C19 may increase the risk of poverty for PWD with recommendations for disability-inclusive actions in response initiatives https://t.co/ro7gcPFibs 3/

In 2020 an additional 88-115 million people had been pushed into extreme poverty due to the pandemic - a number that will be far higher now. COVID has increased the risk of poverty amongst people with disabilities as well as increasing the number of people *with* disabilities  2/

We know poverty is both a cause +consequence of disability-reinforcing each other in a vicious cycle. Over 80% of people with disabilities live in LMIC. COVID/LC has exposed +exacerbated inequalities w/ devastating impacts for PWD esp. those w/ multiple marginalised identities 1/ https://t.co/wCvg0QHpxc

At @FCDOInclusive we prioritise the inclusion +rights of the most marginalised +under-represented #PWD - women and girls w/disabilities in all their diversity are at the very heart of our work to leave no woman or girl behind #BreakTheBias #IWD #DisabilityRights 5/5

In the new #FCDODisabilityStrategy, @FCDOInclusive commits to building a more complete +transparent evidence-base on the lived experience of #PWD, and strengthening collection, analysis + disaggregation of data w/ tools such as the #WGQs @antaraganguli @Ruth_owenOBE @McNhlapo 4/5

At @FCDOInclusive we focus on 4 fundamental outcomes in our work -the Rights, Voice, Choice + Visibility of all #PWD. People w/ disabilities can only have greater visibility through comprehensive, quality data +evidence enabling more responsive programmes, policies + systems 3/5 https://t.co/ZINjP8UHkO

The concept of chronic or ‘incurable’ conditions/disability can be inconceivable to those w/o lived experience. Lack of understanding/empathy +compassion fatigue directly impacts ‘accommodations’ in professional +personal life. Repeated disclosure is exhausting and retraumatising https://t.co/7vbvNnQ6zo

Not comprehensive at all but summarised a few key considerations to ensure Ukrainians with #disabilities are meaningfully included in humanitarian responses @catherinenaugh @MyEDF @InclusionEurope @Age_Int @IDA_CRPD_Forum #Ukraine #UkraineRussia #DisabilityRights https://t.co/s1Q6vcOcUL
Very quick overview on #Disability + #UkraineRussiaCrisis pulled together from @ilo, @WHO, @HelpAge, @MyEDF and @InclusionEurope 1/2 https://t.co/ZyRAjWTWE3

PWD are diverse w/ diff priorities + requirements! Those experiencing multiple, intersecting  +compounding discrimination most likely to be left behind in crises - children/women/older PWD +people w/ intellectual disabilities at higher risk of abuse, neglect, GBV, abandonment 5/n

Crises increases the attitudinal, environmental  +institutional barriers pwd experience. They face disproportionate risk of abandonment, violence +death and lack access to assistance +protection in emergencies - hindering their safety + participation in humanitarian action..4/n

As one of the most excluded groups in society, people with disabilities are more likely to be impacted by these crises as they expose and exacerbate pre-existing inequalities, exclusion, discrimination, marginalisation, violence and barriers to inclusion… 4/n

Crisis disproportionately affect marginalised people  - especially people with disabilities, women and girls, and older people - trapping them in cycles of poverty and vulnerability. Mortality rate of people with disabilities in disasters is 2-4x higher than people without…2/n

As the humanitarian crisis in #Ukraine worsens, we need to talk about why people with #disabilities are among the most at risk tonight.

Firstly framing - conflicts, climate change + COVID are driving a rising tide of humanitarian crises + forced displacement…1/n
People with disabilities, older people and marginalised groups will be disproportionately and potentially devastatingly impacted by this https://t.co/JKbZb0qB6y
